content: sallyscarf is a project that works great as a single skein buster if you re a beginner knitter this project might help you learn a few new techniques i recorded a video to accompany the pattern in which i walk you through each step and demonstrate the techniques used i hope you ll find it helpful sizes one size but you can make the scarf as long as you like by working more repeats of the main motif you can also adjust the width to suit your preferences by increasing or decreasing the initial number of stitches just remember to keep the stitch count odd length approx 160 cm 19 x main motif + 2x twisted rib + 1 decorative motif width approx 27 cm needles 4 mm / 60 cm circular needle materials each color is made up of 3 strands held together 2 strands of wool 50g / 165 210 m + 1 strand of mohair 25g / 210 m in my version i used the following main colors light color drops flora wool 2 x 32g for a total of 64g + approx 16g of drops kid silk mohair /twisted rib + 6 motifs/ medium color drops alpaca wool 2 x 43g for a total of 86g + approx 17g of drops kid silk mohair /7 motifs/ darkest color drops flora wool 2 x 32g for a total of 64g + approx 16g of drops kid silk mohair /6 motifs + twisted rib/ contrast color vilja filcolana 2 x 8g for a total of 16g + approx 5g of drops kid silk mohair /in all motifs / gauge 19 sts x 25 row = 10 x 10 cm in stockinette stitch on a 4 mm needle *last photo shows reverse side
